meanings.definition: The quality or state of being easily annoyed or provoked.
meanings.sent1: Her irritabilities often led to conflicts with her coworkers.
meanings.sent2: His irritabilities were evident when he snapped at the waiter for a small mistake.
meanings.sent3: Despite his irritabilities, he always managed to keep a smile on his face.
meanings.sent4: The classroom was filled with the irritabilities of students eager for the bell to ring.
meanings.sent5: The character's irritabilities in the movie made him relatable to the audience.

meanings.definition: The tendency to become irritated or annoyed easily.
meanings.sent1: The child's irritabilities were triggered by loud noises.
meanings.sent2: She tried to control her irritabilities, but sometimes they got the best of her.
meanings.sent3: His irritabilities seemed to vanish whenever he was around his favorite music.
meanings.sent4: The constant buzzing of the mosquito was like tiny irritabilities in his ear.
meanings.sent5: The heat only added to the irritabilities of the already frustrated crowd.
